decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - C14ADuring groundworks an appropriate scheme of archaeological 	investigative works to be approved by the Local Planning Authority 	shall be carried out. If heritage assets of archaeological interest are 	identified by the evaluation works then before development continues 	the applicant shall secures the implementation of a programme of 	archaeological investigation in accordance with a Written Scheme of 	Investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the local planning authority in writing.
description: Details of condition 5 (prevention of external noise), condition 6 (Landscaping), condition 7 (finishing materials), condition 8 (prevention of dirt and debris) and condition 10 (provision of access for people with disabilities) in respect of planning permission ref no 00607/367-368/P11 dated 19/07/2011 for Conversion of former St Georges Church and Sarah Trimmer Hall (Grade II Listed Building) to 14 residential units, consisting of 9 townhouses, 4 flats and 1 maisonette. The proposal will involve partial demolition of the church (inc removal of chimney & stack and opening up the external walls) and demolition of the kitchen extension to Sarah Trimmer Hall
